title: Business & Finance
text:
Credit Suisse shareholders are bracing for a big hit from the fire sale of positions held by Archegos, a setback that comes on the heels of Greensill's collapse.

---

U.S. home prices are rising at the fastest pace in 15 years, reflecting how fiercely buyers are competing for a limited supply of homes in nearly every part of the country.

---

Consumer confidence in the U.S. rose in March to its highest level since the pandemic started a year ago.

---

JPMorgan , Salesforce and PricewaterhouseCoopers are among major companies looking to unload big blocks of office space.

---

Xiaomi became the latest tech company drawn to China's burgeoning electric-vehicle market, pledging $10 billion over the next decade to its initiative.

---

Major U.S. stock indexes fell, with the Dow industrials and S&P 500 both shedding 0.3% and the Nasdaq slipping 0.1%.

---

Deliveroo priced its IPO at the bottom of its range, valuing the Amazon -backed food-delivery startup at around $10.5 billion.

---

Rival groups of investors are vying for the right to back the expected recovery of Hertz's car-rental business and ease a path out of bankruptcy.
